result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 4, 2023 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 9:43 a.m. 
Clerk: Heather.      
Defendant appears in person, pro se.
COURT questions defendant re: employment/income;
OTR: 9:48 a.m. - BOTR: 10:04 a.m. 
Defendant sworn in and testifies.
Court finds defendant indigent;
COURT appoints Atty Thomas Roley @ $100/hr not to exceed $1,000.00 w/o further order;
Wage Assignment: 100.00 per month.

Remove RH 3/4.
Other dates to remain.

Adj: 10:06 a.m.

Indigency hearing on March 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Review hearing on March 4, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing on March 9, 2022 at 09:10 am.
Final pre-trial on March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.   Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.   Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (4) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amy. 
Case called:  2:25 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Davis Runde.  Defendant appears in custody from MCJ via video with Atty Peter Vu.  

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
PLEA: Not guilty on misd count. 

COURT ORDERS: $750.00 cash bond.  

CONDITIONS: 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- No driving without valid DL. 
- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
